intro: Metrosideros polymorpha var. glabrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved pohuehue, is a variant of the native Hawaiian flowering plant. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in coastal and lowland areas. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glossy leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year. It plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems, providing habitat and food for native wildlife. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens and landscapes beyond Hawaii.
